ul.li1: 1Wilderness and dry land shall be glad,The Hebrew has an extra “them,” probably from an accidental of the first letter of the next word
ul.li2: and desert shall rejoice and blossom like the crocus.
and it shall rejoice indeed with rejoicing and exulting.
ul.li1: The glory of Lebanon shall be given to it,
ul.li2: the majesty of Carmel and Sharon.
ul.li1: They are the ones whoLiterally “they” shall see the glory of Yahweh,
ul.li2: and make the staggering knees firm.

chapter.p: 4Say to those who are hasty of heart,

ul.li2: Look! your God will come with vengeance,
ul.li1: with divine retribution.Literally “the retribution of gods”
ul.li2: He is the one whoLiterally “he” will come and save you.”
ul.li1: 5Then the eyes of the blind shall be opened,
ul.li2: and the ears of the deaf shall be opened.
ul.li1: 6Then the lame shall leap like the deer,
ul.li2: and the tongue of the dumb shall sing for joy,
ul.li1: for waters shall break forth in the wilderness
7And the parched ground shall become a pool,
ul.li2: and the thirsty ground springs of water.
ul.li1: Her resting place is in a settlement of jackals;
ul.li2: the grass shall become like reedsHebrew “reed” and rushes.Hebrew “rush”
ul.li1: 8And a highway shall be there, and a way,
ul.li2: and it shall be called the way of holiness.
ul.li1: The unclean shall not travel through it,
ul.li2: butOr “and” it is for them, he who walks on the way;
and fools shall not wander about.
and no ferocious wild beast shall go up it.
ul.li1: It shall not be found there,
ul.li2: butOr “and” the redeemed shall walk there.
ul.li1: 10And the ransomed of Yahweh shall return,
ul.li2: and they shall come to Zion with rejoicing.
ul.li1: And everlasting joy shall be on their head;
ul.li2: joy and gladness shall overtake them,
ul.li3: and sorrow and sighing shall flee.
